definition: (modal particle indicating suggestion or surmise)/...right?/...OK?/...I presume.
bar (loanword) (serving drinks, or providing Internet access etc)/to puff (on a pipe etc)/(onom.) bang/abbr. for 貼吧|贴吧[tie1 ba1]

sentences.english: I met her in a bar.
sentences.chinese: 我在一家酒吧遇到的她。

sentences.english: We can drop by the bar and go for a drink.
sentences.chinese: 我們可以順便去酒吧喝一杯。

sentences.english: Hooley 's Irish Pub brings an authentic slice of Irish culture to Guangzhou.
sentences.chinese: 胡利的愛爾蘭酒吧給廣州帶來了真正的愛爾蘭文化片。

sentences.english: She was caught trying to sneak into the bar and was booted out.
sentences.chinese: 她被發現偷溜進去該酒吧，之後被踢了出來。

sentences.english: No one in the bar appears surprised to see a disabled person dancing.
sentences.chinese: 看到希福跳舞，酒吧裏的人似乎一點都不喫驚。

sentences.english: You have one where you have almost only pirates in there.
sentences.chinese: 有一家只招待海盜的酒吧。

sentences.english: Disaster situation, the sea shortly world Street bars unable to operate normally.
sentences.chinese: 受災情影響，短期內海上世界酒吧街無法正常開業。

sentences.english: You get a lot of suspicious-looking people in this bar.
sentences.chinese: 你這個酒吧裏有許多人看上去很可疑。

sentences.english: A man walks into a bar one night and asks for 3 drinks.
sentences.chinese: 一天晚上一個男人走進一家酒吧要了三杯酒。

sentences.english: In most British pubs, you have to go to the bar to buy drinks.
sentences.chinese: 在大多數英國酒吧，你得親自到吧檯去買酒。

sentences.english: Las Rocas Bar and Grill is the best spot for fresh seafood specialties.
sentences.chinese: 拉斯羅卡斯酒吧和燒烤是新鮮的海鮮特產的最佳位置。

sentences.english: Lounge patrons desperately wanted to imbibe the essence of all this.
sentences.chinese: 酒吧的老主顧們極欲將全部精華吸收殆盡。
在一家酒吧的毆鬥中被刺殺。

sentences.english: A gang of perverts often gather in this bar.
sentences.chinese: 一幫性變態者經常在那個酒吧聚集。

sentences.english: He visits public-houses and billiards- saloons.
They decided to have something to eat before going to home, but unfortunately the only spot open was a seedy bar-and-grill with a questionable reputation.
sentences.chinese: 但很不巧只有一家名聲不好的下等酒吧烤菜館開着門。

definition: disco/night club/abbr. for 迪斯科廳|迪斯科厅
karaoke hall/singing hall (venue for concerts of popular songs)
compartment (of train, ship etc)/private room at restaurant/rented room for karaoke/hotel room rented by the hour
